verb.definition: Remove or take away (something) from a particular place or position.
verb.example: She withdrew her hand from his.

verb.definition: Leave or cause to leave a place or situation.
verb.example: The troops withdrew from the city.

verb.definition: Take back or discontinue (a statement, offer, or opinion).

noun.definition: The action of withdrawing or removing something.
An act of taking money out of an account.
noun.example: She made a withdrawal from her savings.

usage_examples: I need to withdraw some money from the ATM.
The candidate decided to withdraw from the race.
